reviews.text: Great.
reviews.reason_text: Great comment does not impose any requirement.

reviews.text: I’ll produce a 1,100–1,300 word requirements specification document for a Python-based QASM 2.0 parser.
reviews.reason_text: Request for specification is background information.

reviews.text: It will cover scope, grammar rules, static analysis including checks for common gate errors and undeclared qubits, a GitHub Actions-based CI integration setup, error taxonomy, and a development roadmap with phases and estimated timelines.
reviews.reason_text: Enumerates various enforceable behaviors like scope coverage, static analysis checks, CI integration, error taxonomy, and a development roadmap.

reviews.text: I’ll get back to you shortly with the complete specification.
reviews.reason_text: Comment about returning is background information.

reviews.text:
# QASM 2.0 Parser and Static Analyzer – Requirements Specification

## Scope
reviews.reason_text: Describes the scope of the tool without imposing enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: This tool is a Python-based static **parser and analyzer** for the OpenQASM 2.0 language.
reviews.reason_text: Describes the functionality but does not impose enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: It will read QASM 2.0 source files (including any included libraries) and perform syntactic and semantic validation without executing the program.
reviews.reason_text: Describes syntactic validation without executing the program, an enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Primary functions include constructing an abstract syntax tree (AST) of the QASM program, building symbol tables for quantum and classical registers and user-defined gates, and performing static checks to catch errors.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes specific AST construction and error checking behavior.

reviews.text: The tool should report clear error messages and warnings for invalid QASM constructs.
reviews.reason_text: Orders the tool to report errors and warnings for invalid constructs.

reviews.text: **Out of scope** features include any runtime execution or simulation of quantum circuits, optimization or translation of QASM to another form, and support for newer languages like OpenQASM 3.0.
reviews.reason_text: Out of scope features are provided without enforcing new behavior.

reviews.text: The focus is entirely on *parsing* QASM 2.0 and *static analysis* of the code for correctness.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes correct parsing and static analysis behavior.

reviews.text:
## Grammar Rules  
The analyzer must implement the full OpenQASM 2.0 grammar as specified by IBM’s QASM reference ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))
reviews.reason_text: Enforces specific grammar rules from OpenQASM.

reviews.text: ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·
reviews.reason_text: Part of the specification file without new enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body)).
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text:
Key elements to parse include:

- **Version Declaration:**
reviews.reason_text: Imposes version declaration correctness.

reviews.text: The first non-comment line must be `OPENQASM M.m;` with `M.m` the version (here `2.0`) ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes correct first line format constraint.

reviews.text: Only one version statement is allowed and it must appear first.
reviews.reason_text: Mandates the uniqueness and placement of version statements.

reviews.text: Statements are separated by semicolons; whitespace is ignored.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes statement separation by semicolons.

reviews.text: Comments begin with `//` and run to end-of-line ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes comment formatting rules to maintain code readability.

reviews.text: - **Include Statements:** Lines of the form `include "filename";` must be parsed so that the specified file is opened and its contents processed in place ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working)).
reviews.reason_text: Orders the parser to include statements and ensure proper syntax.

reviews.text: The include path is relative to the current working directory.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes relative include path constraint.

reviews.text: - **Registers:**
reviews.reason_text: Lists built-in gates without enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Support declarations `qreg name[size];` and `creg name[size];` for quantum and classical registers ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20only%20storage%20types%20of,to%20a%20bit%20of%20this)).
reviews.reason_text: mandates quantum register declarations with specific parameters.

reviews.text: Identifier names start with a lowercase letter and may contain alphanumeric characters or underscores ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20only%20storage%20types%20of,to%20a%20bit%20of%20this)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes naming conventions for identifiers to maintain consistency.

reviews.text: For `qreg name[N]`, the elements `name[j]` for `0 ≤ j < N` denote individual qubits initialized to |0〉; similarly `creg name[N]` defines bits `name[j]` initialized to 0
reviews.reason_text: Define initialization behavior for quantum and classical registers.

reviews.text: ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·
reviews.reason_text: Part of the specification file without new enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20only%20storage%20types%20of,to%20a%20bit%20of%20this)).
reviews.reason_text: Part of the specification file without new enforceable behavior.

reviews.text:
- **Built-in Gates:** Handle all built-in quantum instructions in QASM 2.0:
  - `U(theta,phi,lambda) q;` applies a parameterized single-qubit unitary to `q` (or applies in parallel over a quantum register)
reviews.reason_text: Imposes built-in gate instruction format.

reviews.text: ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·

reviews.reason_text: Imposes parameter expression constraint.

reviews.text: The parameters are real-valued expressions (angles) appearing in parentheses.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes single-qubit gate parameter format.

reviews.text: - `CX q1,q2;` applies a CNOT gate with control `q1` and target `q2` ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20built,quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes specific gate operation syntax and parameters.

reviews.text: If the arguments are quantum registers of equal size, it is implicitly parallelized elementwise ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20built,quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa))
reviews.reason_text: Imposes implicit parallelization constraint.

reviews.text: ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·
reviews.reason_text: Imposes quantum register size equality constraint.

reviews.text: Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=called%20the%20controlled,index%20j%20into%20register%20a)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes behavior on quantum measurement syntax, though less explicit.

reviews.text: - `measure q -> c;` measures qubit(s) `q` (single qubit or register) into classical bit(s) `c` ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built,c)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes specific measure operation syntax and parameters.

reviews.text: `q` must be qubit(s) and `c` must be bit(s); the arrow `->` syntax is required.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes constraints on valid quantum register and classical bit usage.

reviews.text: - `reset q;` resets qubit(s) `q` to the |0〉 state ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·
reviews.reason_text: Reset qubit(s) to the |0〉 state.

reviews.text: Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built,c)).
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: - `barrier q1,q2,...;` is a compiler barrier (no-op) applying to listed qubits or registers ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·
reviews.reason_text: Barrier qubits or registers to prevent reordering.

reviews.text: Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=gatename%28params%29%20qargs%3B%20Apply%20a%20user,1)).
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: It prevents reordering across the barrier.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: - **Gate Definitions:**
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text:
Support user-defined gate (subroutine) syntax as per the QASM 2.0 spec ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body)):
  - **Named Gates:** `gate name(params) qargs { body }`.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes gate definition syntax and parameters.

reviews.text: Here `params` is an optional comma-separated list of parameter identifiers, and `qargs` is a comma-separated list of qubit identifiers ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·

reviews.text: Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body)).
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: The body is a block of existing gate calls (built-in or previously defined gates) and barrier statements ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=%2F%2F%20comment%20gate%20name,body))

reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: The parentheses around `params` are optional if empty.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: Each `qarg` is a local symbol for a qubit argument; it **cannot** be indexed inside the gate body ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master ·
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: - **Opaque Gates:** `opaque name(params) qargs;` declares a gate whose implementation is unspecified (no body) ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=computationally%20challenging%20to%20estimate,declaration%20but%20without%20a%20body)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes opaque gate definition without body, requiring separate declaration.

reviews.text: The syntax is the same as a `gate` declaration but without the `{ body }`.

reviews.text: In definitions, built-in or previously-defined gates and barriers are the only allowed statements (no measurements or resets inside a gate body).
reviews.reason_text: Built-in gates and barriers are the only allowed statements.

reviews.text: Subroutines (gates) must be declared before use and cannot be recursive ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=Only%20built,The%20quantum%20circuit%20given%20by)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes restrictions on recursive gate definitions and usage.

reviews.text: The parser should faithfully implement the QASM 2.0 grammar for all of the above constructs, reporting syntax errors (e.g. missing semicolons, mismatched parentheses, invalid tokens) as parsing failures.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes enforcement of version statement placement and semicolon usage.

reviews.text: In particular, it should enforce that the version statement occurs only once at the top and that all statements end with semicolons as required ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20syntax%20of%20the%20human,relative%20to%20the%20current%20working))

reviews.text:
## Static Analysis  
After syntactic parsing, the tool performs semantic and static checks on the AST.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text:
Key checks include:

- **Symbol Table and Declarations:**
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: Build symbol tables for quantum registers, classical registers, and gates.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: Report an error if a qubit or bit is referenced (e.g. in a gate call or index) without a prior `qreg` or `creg` declaration, or if a gate is called without a prior `gate` or `opaque` declaration.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces proper qubit/bit referencing without prior declarations.

reviews.text: Similarly, flag duplicate declarations of registers or gates.
reviews.reason_text: Flags duplicate register or gate declarations to prevent errors.

reviews.text: - **Index Bounds and Uniqueness:*
reviews.reason_text: Discusses index bounds but doesn't enforce behavior.

reviews.text: * Ensure that any indexed reference `name[i]` uses `0 ≤
reviews.reason_text: Ensures indexed references use valid bounds.

reviews.text: i < size(name)` as declared ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20only%20storage%20types%20of,to%20a%20bit%20of%20this)).
reviews.reason_text: Flags out-of-range index errors.

reviews.text: Flag out-of-range indices as errors.
reviews.reason_text: Verifies indexed references within valid bounds.

reviews.text: For multi-qubit gates (like `CX q1,q2`), check that the same qubit is not used twice (for example, `CX q[0],q[0]` is invalid); the QASM spec explicitly forbids the same qubit in both roles ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=called%20the%20controlled,register%20and%20b%20is%20a)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes constraint on qubit reuse in gates.

reviews.text: In general, if a parallel operation is applied to quantum registers, they must have matching sizes.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces quantum register size consistency.

reviews.text: - **Type and Context Checks:** Verify operand types for each operation.
reviews.reason_text: Discusses type checks without enforcing them.

reviews.text: For example, a unitary `U` or custom gate must take quantum arguments (qubit or qreg), not classical bits, and `measure` must map qubits to bits ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=U%28theta%2Cphi%2Clambda%29%20qubit%7Cqreg%3B%20Apply%20built,c)).
reviews.reason_text: Explains gate parameters, not enforceable rules.

reviews.text: The `if` statement syntax `if(creg==int) qop;` must use a classical register on the left of `==` and an integer literal on the right.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes syntax rule for `if` statements.

reviews.text: Applying a gate to a classical register, or a measurement target that is not a classical bit, should be flagged.
reviews.reason_text: Flagging incorrect gate applications.

reviews.text: Likewise, verify that classical constructs (constants, integer expressions) are not misused in quantum contexts.
reviews.reason_text: Explains operand types but doesn't enforce validation.

reviews.text: - **Gate Arity and Parameters:** Check that gate invocations have the correct number of arguments.
reviews.reason_text: Discusses gate arity without enforcing checks.

reviews.text: For built-in gates, `CX` must have exactly two quantum arguments ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=The%20built,quantum%20register%20and%20vice%20versa)), and `U` must have three real-parameter arguments.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes gate argument constraints.

reviews.text: For user-defined gates, ensure that the number of provided qubit arguments matches its declaration, and that the number of parameter expressions matches the declared parameters.
reviews.reason_text: Enforces correct qubit and parameter counts for gates.

reviews.text: Type-check parameter expressions (e.g. they must be numeric expressions involving constants or π, not bits).
reviews.reason_text: Enforces valid parameter expressions.

reviews.text: Report mismatches or missing parameters.
reviews.reason_text: Flags mismatches or missing parameters.

reviews.text: - **Gate Definition Constraints:**
reviews.reason_text: Discusses gate definitions without enforcing checks.

reviews.text: In gate definitions, ensure bodies follow spec rules ([openqasm/spec/qasm2.rst at master · Mezantrop74/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/Mezantrop74/openqasm/blob/master/spec/qasm2.rst#:~:text=Only%20built,The%20quantum%20circuit%20given%20by)).
reviews.reason_text: Describes QASM validation, not enforceable rules.

reviews.text: For example, parameter names and qubit arguments should be properly scoped, and only allowed statements (gates, barrier) appear.
reviews.reason_text: Explains gate argument scoping, not enforceable rules.

reviews.text: Detect recursive definitions (a gate calling itself) and flag as invalid.
reviews.reason_text: Flags recursive gate definitions.

reviews.text: - **Unused Symbols and Logical Warnings:**
reviews.reason_text: Discusses warnings without enforcing them.

reviews.text: As a courtesy, warn about unreferenced entities (defined gates or registers that are never used).
reviews.reason_text: Warns about unused entities but doesn't enforce.

reviews.text: Also, flag potential logical issues: e.g., calling a quantum gate on a qubit after that qubit has been measured (without an intervening `reset`) ([Analyzing Quantum Programs with LintQ: A Static Analysis Framework for Qiskit](https://software-lab.org/publications/fse2024_LintQ.pdf#:~:text=analysis%20aimed%20at%20warning%20about,10%20operate%20on%20the%20same)), or `if` conditions that are constant-false/true and thus dead code.
reviews.reason_text: Flags logical issues in gate usage.

reviews.text: These are not syntax errors but potential logic bugs, and should be reported as warnings.
reviews.reason_text: Reports potential bugs, not enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Collectively, these checks will catch common QASM mistakes such as undeclared qubits, duplicate registers, wrong gate arity, type errors, and unreachable or ill-formed code.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes common QASM mistakes.

reviews.text: For example, if a gate name is undefined, the analyzer should produce a compile-time error (“gate X undefined”) ([Support `extern` gate declarations  · Issue #507 · openqasm/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/openqasm/openqasm/issues/507#:~:text=In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before,them%20available%20to%20the%20user)) rather than silently proceeding.
reviews.reason_text: Imposes gate name definition errors.

reviews.text: This ensures that the QASM program is well-formed before any execution attempt.
reviews.reason_text: Ensures well-formed QASM programs.

reviews.text: ## CI Integration
reviews.reason_text: Discusses CI integration without enforcing behavior.

reviews.text: The project will use **GitHub Actions** for continuous integration (CI) to ensure code quality and reliability.
reviews.reason_text: Describes CI/CD tools usage, not enforceable behavior.

reviews.text:
A typical workflow includes:

- **Automated Tests:**
reviews.reason_text: Explains workflow but doesn't enforce anything.

reviews.text:
## Error Taxonomy  
Errors and warnings generated by the parser/analyzer are classified as follows:

- **Syntax Errors:**
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: These are violations of the QASM grammar detected by the parser.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: Examples include a missing semicolon, unmatched brackets, malformed `if` or `include` syntax, or using a keyword incorrectly.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: A syntax error halts parsing and reports the offending line and expected tokens.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: For instance, writing `qreg q[3]` without a semicolon would be a syntax error.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: - **Semantic Errors:**
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: These occur after parsing, during symbol resolution and type checking.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: They include using an undeclared register or gate, referencing an out-of-bounds index, duplicating a declaration name, or mismatching gate arity/types.
reviews.reason_text: Missing from LLM output; defaulted.

reviews.text: For example, calling `CX q[0], c[0]` (using a classical bit as a CX argument) or invoking a gate with too many parameters would be semantic errors.
reviews.reason_text: Semantic errors result from using a classical bit as a CX argument or gates with too many parameters.

reviews.text: Undefined-gate errors are semantic; as one report notes, “the frontend will record an error saying that the gate `cx` is undefined” when it cannot find a gate symbol ([Support `extern` gate declarations  · Issue #507 · openqasm/openqasm · GitHub](https://github.com/openqasm/openqasm/issues/507#:~:text=In%20this%20case%2C%20long%20before,them%20available%20to%20the%20user)).
reviews.reason_text: Describes undefined-gate errors which imply enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: Semantic errors prevent code generation or further analysis.
reviews.reason_text: Describes consequences without imposing enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: - **Logical (Design) Warnings:**
reviews.reason_text: Details warnings about logical flaws, not enforceable behavior.

reviews.text: These are issues that do not violate syntax or basic semantics but likely indicate a logical flaw.
reviews.reason_text: Observes issues without imposing constraints.

reviews.text: Examples include gates or registers that are defined but never used (dead code), or operations on a qubit after it has been measured without reset (since the qubit’s state is no longer well-defined) ([Analyzing Quantum Programs with LintQ: A Static Analysis Framework for Qiskit](https://software-lab.org/publications/fse2024_LintQ.pdf#:~:text=analysis%20aimed%20at%20warning%20about,10%20operate%20on%20the%20same)).
reviews.reason_text: Imposes an obligation to analyze gates used in quantum programs.

reviews.text: Another example is a constant condition in `if` that always skips or always executes a branch, which could indicate a mistake.
reviews.reason_text: Flagged errors that don't stop compilation.

reviews.text: These do not stop compilation but are flagged to the user for review.
reviews.reason_text: Explains error handling without enforcing actions.

reviews.text: - **Runtime-Preventable Logical Errors:**
reviews.reason_text: Outlines runtime preventable errors but doesn't enforce behavior.

reviews.text: In the context of static analysis, we aim to catch as many potential bugs as possible before runtime.
reviews.reason_text: Explains static analysis goals without enforcing constraints.

reviews.text: This includes checks like ensuring that two-qubit gates are not applied to the same qubit (caught as semantic) and warnings if the programmer’s stated intent (e.g. parallel gate application) might break if gates do not commute.
reviews.reason_text: Checks enforce semantic correctness of gates and warnings about parallel application.

reviews.text: Any error that can be detected without running the circuit is reported.
reviews.reason_text: Describes error detection without enforcing actions.

reviews.text:
This structured error taxonomy (syntax vs semantic vs logical) helps users understand the nature of an issue: syntax and semantic errors must be fixed, while logical warnings may highlight inefficiencies or non-critical problems.

reviews.reason_text: Describes structured error taxonomy which is background information.
